alert.note: Alert for Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:51PM EST until January 11 at 7:25AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central New Jersey, including the following county, Monmouth. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 PM EST, flooding was ongoing. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain fell last night. - For Manasquan at Allenwood: At 1:15pm the stage was 15.22 feet. Flood Stage is 14.5 feet. For Manasquan at Squankum: At 1:30pm the stage was 8.53 feet. Flood Stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
